children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestAndFeeIncomeLoansConsumerHomeEquity
children.description: Interest and fee income from home equity lines-of-credit extended to individuals (borrowers). Such loans are generally secured by the borrower's equity in her or his home.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestAndFeeIncomeLoansConsumerInstallmentAutomobilesMarineAndOtherVehicles
children.description: Interest and fee income generated by automobile, marine, and other vehicle loans made to individuals.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestAndFeeIncomeLoansConsumerInstallmentCreditCard
children.description: Interest and fee income from credit card balances due from individuals. Such loans are considered revolving credit arrangements.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestAndFeeIncomeLoansOtherConsumer
children.description: Interest and fee income from other loans extended to individual consumers.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Interest and fee income generated from consumer loans. Consumer loans are loans to individuals for household, family, and other personal expenditures. Such loans include residential mortgages, home equity lines-of-credit, automobiles and marine transport loans, credit card transactions, and others.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestAndFeeIncomeLoansForeign
children.description: Interest and fee income generated by commercial and consumer loans, made by foreign branches of the reporting entity, which may include loans to foreign governments, foreign banks and other financial institutions, commercial and industrial entities, and citizens of not domiciled in the same country as the reporting entity.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: AmortizationOfDeferredLoanOriginationFeesNet
children.description: The net increase(decrease) in interest income during the period representing the allocation of deferred loan origination fees less deferred loan origination costs using the effective interest method over the term of the debt arrangement to which they pertain taking into account the effect of prepayments.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestAndFeeIncomeOtherLoans
children.description: Amount of interest and fee income from loans classified as other.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Interest and fee income generated by loans the Entity intends and has the ability to hold for the foreseeable future, or until maturity or payoff, including commercial and consumer loans, whether domestic or foreign, which may consist of: (1) industrial and agricultural; (2) real estate; and (3) real estate construction loans; (4) trade financing; (5) lease financing; (6) home equity lines-of-credit; (7) automobile and other vehicle loans; and (8) credit card and other revolving-type loans. Also includes interest income for leases held by the Entity.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: The aggregate interest and fee income generated by: (1) loans the Entity has positive intent and ability to hold for the foreseeable future, or until maturity or payoff, including commercial and consumer loans, whether domestic or foreign, which may consist of: (a) industrial and agricultural; (b) real estate; and (c) real estate construction loans; (d) trade financing; (e) lease financing; (f) home equity lines-of-credit; (g) automobile and other vehicle loans; and (h) credit card and other revolving-type loans and (2) loans and leases held-for-sale which may include mortgage loans, direct financing, and sales-type leases.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestIncomeAndFeesBankersAcceptancesCertificatesOfDepositAndCommercialPaper
children.description: Interest and fee income derived from banker's acceptances, certificates of deposit and commercial paper.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestIncomePurchasedReceivables
children.description: Interest earned from receivables purchased; for instance, receivables purchased through a factoring arrangement.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestIncomeDepositsWithFinancialInstitutions
InterestIncomeDomesticDeposits
InterestIncomeMoneyMarketDeposits
children.description: Interest earned on funds deposited in US domestic money market accounts.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestIncomeOtherDomesticDeposits
children.description: Amount of interest earned on US domestic deposits classified as other. Excludes money market accounts.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Interest earned on deposits in United States money market accounts and other United States interest earning accounts.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestIncomeForeignDeposits
children.description: Interest income generated from amounts on deposit with foreign entities located outside the United States of America.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Interest income derived from funds deposited with both domestic and foreign financial institutions including funds in money market and other accounts.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestIncomeFederalFundsSoldAndSecuritiesPurchasedUnderAgreementsToResell
InterestIncomeFederalFundsSold
children.description: Interest income on federal funds sold. Federal funds sold represent the excess federal funds held by one commercial bank which it lends to another commercial bank, usually at an agreed-upon (federal funds) rate of interest. Such loans generally are of short-duration (overnight).
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestIncomeSecuritiesPurchasedUnderAgreementsToResell
children.description: Interest income derived from securities purchased under agreements to resell. The difference in the price at which the institution buys the securities and resells the securities represents interest for the use of the funds by the other party. Most repurchase and sale agreements involve obligations of the federal government or its agencies, but other financial instruments, such as commercial paper, banker's acceptances and negotiable certificates of deposits are sometimes used in such transactions.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: The aggregate interest income earned from (1) the lending of excess federal funds to another commercial bank requiring such for its legal reserve requirements and (2) securities purchased under agreements to resell.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestIncomeOperating
InterestIncomeSecuritiesTaxable
children.description: Amount of operating interest income, including amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts, on securities subject to state, federal and other income tax.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestIncomeSecuritiesTaxExempt
children.description: Amount of operating interest income, including amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts, on securities exempt from state, federal and other income tax.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InterestIncomeSecuritiesTaxAdvantaged
children.description: Amount of operating interest income, including amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts, on securities subject to tax benefits. Excludes operating interest income on securities exempt from state, federal and other income tax.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Amount of operating interest income, including, but not limited to, amortization and accretion of premiums and discounts on securities.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: DividendIncomeOperating
DividendIncomeSecuritiesOperatingTaxable
children.description: Amount of operating dividend income on securities subject to state, federal and other income tax.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: DividendIncomeSecuritiesOperatingTaxExempt
children.description: Amount of operating dividend income on securities exempt from state, federal and other income tax.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: DividendIncomeSecuritiesOperatingTaxAdvantaged
children.description: Amount of operating dividend income on securities subject to tax benefits. Excludes operating dividend income on securities exempt from state, federal and other income tax.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Amount of operating dividend income on securities.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: OtherInterestAndDividendIncome
children.description: Amount, after discount, accretion and premium amortization, of interest income and dividend income classified as other.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InsuranceInvestmentIncome
children.description: Investment income associated with the company's insurance services.

children.description: Amount, after investment expense, of income earned from investments in securities and real estate. Includes, but is not limited to, real estate investment, policy loans, dividends, and interest. Excludes realized gain (loss) on investments.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: RealizedInvestmentGainsLosses
children.description: Amount of realized gain (loss) on investment.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: RevenuesExcludingInterestAndDividends
BrokerageCommissionsRevenue
children.description: Amount of commission revenue from buying and selling securities on behalf of customers.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: InvestmentBankingRevenue
children.description: Includes (1) underwriting revenue (the spread between the resale price received and the cost of the securities and related expenses) generated through the purchasing, distributing and reselling of new issues of securities (alternatively, could be a secondary offering of a large block of previously issued securities); and (2) fees earned for mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, restructurings, and other types of financial advisory services.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: UnderwritingIncomeLoss
children.description: The difference between the price paid by the public and the contract price less the related expenses. A broker-dealer may underwrite a security offering by contracting to buy the issue either at a fixed price or a price based on selling the offering on a best-effort basis.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: PrincipalTransactionsRevenue
TradingGainsLosses
TradingActivityGain
children.description: The net gain on trading activities (including both derivative and nonderivative instruments) recognized in the statement of financial performance.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: TradingActivityLoss
children.description: The loss on trading activities (including both derivative and nonderivative instruments) recognized in the statement of financial performance.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Amount of gain (loss) resulting from the difference between the acquisition price and the selling price or fair value of trading assets and trading liabilities, conducted separately from customer trading activities. Includes, but is not limited to, changes in fair value of trading assets and trading liabilities.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: PrincipalInvestmentGainsLosses
children.description: Amount of realized and unrealized gain (loss), from the firm's direct investment activity, conducted separately from customer trading activities, and includes, but is not limited to, investments in private equity, alternative investment products, real estate, and exchanges and memberships.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Amount of realized and unrealized gain (loss) resulting from the difference between acquisition price and selling price or fair value of trading assets and trading liabilities, and from the firm's direct investment activity, conducted separately from customer trading activities, including, but not limited to, investments in private equity, alternative investment products, real estate, and exchanges and memberships.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: MarketDataRevenue
children.description: Amount of revenue from market data services, including, but not limited to, information about current quotes and most recent prices for a specific security.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Revenues from operations, excluding interest and dividend income. Includes revenues from the following sources: investment banking (underwriting and financial advisory), principal transactions (sales and trading, and investment gains and losses), commissions, asset management, and investment advisory and other services.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: OtherOperatingIncome
children.description: The total amount of other operating income, the components of which are not separately disclosed on the income statement, from items that are associated with the entity's normal revenue producing operation.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: FeeIncome
children.description: Amount of fee income including, but not limited to, managerial assistance, servicing of investment, and origination and commitment fees.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: OtherIncome
children.description: Amount of revenue and income classified as other.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Amount of revenue recognized from goods sold, services rendered, insurance premiums, or other activities that constitute an earning process. Includes, but is not limited to, investment and interest income before deduction of interest expense when recognized as a component of revenue, and sales and trading gain (loss).
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: CostOfRevenue
CostOfGoodsAndServicesSold
CostOfGoodsAndServiceExcludingDepreciationDepletionAndAmortization

children.description: Indirect cost incurred related to good produced and service rendered.

children.description: Cost of maintenance incurred and directly related to good produced and service rendered.

children.description: Amount of tax incurred and cost of license directly related to good produced or service rendered.

children.description: Cost of trust assets sold to pay trust expenses (includes commodities, but is not limited to, gold and silver).

children.description: Other operating costs incurred during the reporting period and may include amounts paid to maintain the property.

WaterProductionCosts
children.description: Cost incurred related to water production and may include cost of treatment plants, pumps, pipes and reservoir, purchased water, power and pump taxes as well as the cost of reducing water leakage.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Cost of water purchased, may include any water related assessment. If water is bought on a unit volume basis, would also be considered as commodity costs.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: RecoveryOfDirectCosts
children.description: Return of or reimbursements received in relation to direct costs and expenses previously paid or incurred.

children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

DirectOperatingCommunicationsCosts

children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

AircraftRental

children.description: Direct costs incurred at airports in which the entity conducts flight operations. The costs primarily consist of fees paid to the airport authority for takeoff and landing, gate space and facilities, allocations of common space such as security and other terminal costs and fuel storage facilities.

children.description: Expenses incurred related to the lease of aircraft from outside third parties that are used in the entity's business operations and direct costs incurred at airports primarily consisting of fees paid to the airport authority for takeoff and landing, gate and facility fees, and other related fees.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: The aggregate direct operating costs incurred during the reporting period.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Costs associated with revenues arising from an entity that is an affiliate of the reporting entity by means of direct or indirect ownership.

children.description: Amount of loss recognized on firm purchase commitment for inventory.

children.description: The amount of excise and sales taxes included in sales and revenues, which are then deducted as a cost of sales. Includes excise taxes, which are applied to specific types of transactions or items (such as gasoline or alcohol); and sales, use and value added taxes, which are applied to a broad class of revenue-producing transactions involving a wide range of goods and services.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

InventoryWriteDown
children.description: Amount of loss from reductions in inventory due to subsequent measurement adjustments, including, but not limited to, physical deterioration, obsolescence, or changes in price levels.

children.description: Nonrecurring impairment charges related to the write-off of production-related equipment and inventory. This tag is used when an Entity charges this cost to cost of goods sold.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Cost of product sold and service rendered, excluding depreciation, depletion, and amortization.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: CostDepreciationAmortizationAndDepletion
CostOfGoodsAndServicesSoldDepreciationAndAmortization
CostOfGoodsAndServicesSoldDepreciation
children.description: Amount of expense for allocation of cost of tangible asset over its useful life directly used in production of good and rendering of service.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: CostOfGoodsAndServicesSoldAmortization
children.description: Amount of expense for allocation of cost of intangible asset over its useful life directly used in production of good and rendering of service.

children.description: Amount of expense for allocation of cost of tangible and intangible assets over their useful lives directly used in production of good and rendering of service.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: CostDepletion
children.description: Cost of reduction in quantity of natural resource due to consumption directly related to good produced and service rendered.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Amount of expense for allocation of cost of tangible and intangible assets over their useful lives, and reduction in quantity of natural resource due to consumption directly used in production of good and rendering of service.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: The aggregate costs related to goods produced and sold and services rendered by an entity during the reporting period. This excludes costs incurred during the reporting period related to financial services rendered and other revenue generating activities.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: This element represents interest incurred for borrowed money which was used to produce goods or render services.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: ProvisionForLoanLeaseAndOtherLosses
ProvisionForOtherCreditLosses
children.description: Amount of expense related to credit loss from transactions other than loan and lease transactions.

children.description: Amount of expense related to other loss.

children.name: ProvisionForLoanLossesExpensed

children.description: Amount of expense (reversal of expense) for expected credit loss on net investment in sales-type and direct financing leases.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Amount of expense related loan transactions, lease transactions, credit loss from transactions other than loan and lease transactions, and other loss based on assessment of uncollectability from the counterparty to reduce the account to their net realizable value.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

PolicyholderBenefitsAndClaimsIncurredGross

ReinsuranceEffectOnClaimsAndBenefitsIncurredAmountAssumed

children.description: Amount of reduction of provision for policy benefits and costs incurred for policies ceded.

children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Amount, after effects of policies assumed or ceded, of expense related to the provision for policy benefits and costs incurred.

children.description: Amount of expense (income) recognized due to changes in the accrued obligation to policyholders that relates to insured events.

children.description: Amount of interest expense for allocation to policyholder account balance.

children.description: Amount of expense for dividends to policyholders.

children.description: Amount of amortization expense (reversal of expense) for deferred sales inducement cost.

children.description: Amount of amortization expense (reversal of expense) for present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.

children.name: AmortizationOfMortgageServicingRightsMSRs
children.description: The periodic amortization (in proportion to and over the period of estimated net servicing income or loss) of capitalized servicing rights, which contractually entitle the servicer to receive fees and ancillary revenues for performing billing, collection, disbursement and recordkeeping services in connection with a mortgage portfolio. As a noncash expense, this element is added back to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: DeferredPolicyAcquisitionCostAmortizationExpense
children.description: Amount of amortization expense (reversal of expense) for deferred policy acquisition costs.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: AmortizationOfValueOfBusinessAcquiredVOBA
children.description: The adjustment that represents the periodic charge against earnings to reduce the value of business acquired (VOBA) over the expected life of the underlying insurance contracts. VOBA reflects the estimated fair value of a life insurance business in force and represents the portion of the cost to acquire the business that is allocated to the value of the right to receive future cash flows from insurance contracts existing at the date of acquisition. Such value is the present value of the actuarially determined projected cash flows for the acquired policies. As a noncash expense, this element is added back to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: OtherCostOfOperatingRevenue

children.name: MerchantMarineOperatingDifferentialSubsidy
children.description: Amount of operating-differential subsidy received pursuant to Merchant Marine Act of 1936.

children.description: The aggregate cost of goods produced and sold and services rendered during the reporting period.

children.description: Amount of expense for research and development. Includes, but is not limited to, cost for computer software product to be sold, leased, or otherwise marketed and writeoff of research and development assets acquired in transaction other than business combination or joint venture formation or both. Excludes write-down of intangible asset acquired in business combination or from joint venture formation or both, used in research and development activity.

children.name: DepreciationAndAmortization
DepreciationNonproduction

children.name: DepletionOfOilAndGasProperties
children.description: The noncash expense charged against earnings to recognize the consumption of oil and gas reserves that are part of an entities' assets.

children.name: AmortizationOfDeferredCharges
AmortizationOfAcquisitionCosts
children.description: The amount of expense recognized in the current period that reflects the allocation of capitalized costs associated with acquisition of business. As a noncash expense, this element is added back to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.

children.name: AmortizationOfIntangibleAssets
children.description: The aggregate expense charged against earnings to allocate the cost of intangible assets (nonphysical assets not used in production) in a systematic and rational manner to the periods expected to benefit from such assets.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: AmortizationOfDeferredSalesCommissions
children.description: The amount of expense recognized in the current period for the periodic realization of capitalized fees that were paid to salespeople, distributors, brokers, and agents at the time of the conclusion of the sale. As a noncash expense, this element is added back to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: AmortizationOfRegulatoryAsset
children.description: The expense charged against earnings during the period to allocate the capitalized costs of regulatory assets over the periods expected to benefit from such costs.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: FinanceLeaseRightOfUseAssetAmortization
children.description: Amount of amortization expense attributable to right-of-use asset from finance lease.

children.name: AmortizationOfPowerContractsEmissionCredits
children.description: The expense charged against earnings for the periodic recognition of capitalized costs related to purchasing power, fuel, or emission credits. These items may be purchased in one accounting period but are deducted from earnings over time through amortization.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: AmortizationOfNuclearFuelLease
children.description: Amount of amortization of nuclear fuel.

children.name: AmortizationOfAdvanceRoyalty
children.description: The expense charged against earnings for the periodic recognition of the advance royalties. These royalties are paid in one accounting period, but are deducted from earnings over time through amortization. For example, royalties that are required to be paid in advance of production from a mineral, oil, or gas property and amortized over the period of right to produce these items.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: AmortizationOfDeferredPropertyTaxes
children.description: The amount of amortization charged against earnings during the period for deferred property taxes.

children.name: AmortizationOfRateDeferral
children.description: The periodic expense to reduce the value of the rate deferral asset that is created when utilities under bill customers during periods of rate increases by deferring rate increases. These customers eventually pay higher rates to repay the utility for the rate deferral.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: AmortizationOfDeferredHedgeGains
children.description: The amount of expense charged against earnings by an Entity to record deferred gains and losses on hedge instruments. Examples include gain on economic hedges, amortization of gain on designated fair value hedge and so forth.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: AmortizationAndDepreciationOfDecontaminatingAndDecommissioningAssets
children.description: The current period expense charged against earnings on decontaminating and decommissioning of facilities used in the normal conduct of business and not intended for resale to allocate or recognize the cost of the assets over their useful lives.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: OtherAmortizationOfDeferredCharges
children.description: Amount of amortization of other deferred costs recognized in the income statement.

children.description: Amount of expense charged against earnings to allocate the cost of tangible and intangible assets over their remaining economic lives, classified as other.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: The current period expense charged against earnings on long-lived, physical assets not used in production, and which are not intended for resale, to allocate or recognize the cost of such assets over their useful lives; or to record the reduction in book value of an intangible asset over the benefit period of such asset; or to reflect consumption during the period of an asset that is not used in production.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: ExplorationExpense
children.description: Exploration expenses (including prospecting) related to oil and gas producing entities and would be included in operating expenses of that entity. Costs incurred in identifying areas that may warrant examination and in examining specific areas that are considered to have prospects of containing oil and gas reserves, including costs of drilling exploratory wells and exploratory-type stratigraphic test wells. Exploration costs may be incurred both before acquiring the related property (sometimes referred to in part as prospecting costs) and after acquiring the property. Principal types of exploration costs, which include depreciation and applicable operating costs of support equipment and facilities and other costs of exploration activities, are: (i) Costs of topographical, geographical and geophysical studies, rights of access to properties to conduct those studies, and salaries and other expenses of geologists, geophysical crews, and others conducting those studies. Collectively, these are sometimes referred to as geological and geophysical or "G&G" costs. (ii) Costs of carrying and retaining undeveloped properties, such as delay rentals, ad valorem taxes on properties, legal costs for title defense, and the maintenance of land and lease records. (iii) Dry hole contributions and bottom hole contributions. (iv) Costs of drilling and equipping exploratory wells. (v) Costs of drilling exploratory-type stratigraphic test wells.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: CarryingCostsPropertyAndExplorationRights
children.description: The costs incurred to retain exploration and property rights after acquisition but before production has occurred. Costs include legal costs for title defense, ad valorem taxes on nonproducing mineral properties, shut-in royalties, and delay rentals.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: RecapitalizationCosts

children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: RestructuringSettlementAndImpairmentProvisions

children.description: Amount of expenses associated with exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Includes, but is not limited to, one-time termination benefits, termination of an operating lease or other contract, consolidating or closing facilities, and relocating employees, and termination benefits associated with an ongoing benefit arrangement. Excludes expenses associated with special or contractual termination benefits, a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: SeveranceCosts1
children.description: Amount of expenses for special or contractual termination benefits provided to current employees involuntarily terminated under a benefit arrangement associated exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Excludes expenses related to one-time termination benefits, a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: OtherRestructuringCosts
children.description: Amount of other expenses associated with exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Excludes expenses associated with a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

children.description: Amount of expenses associated with exit or disposal activities pursuant to an authorized plan. Excludes expenses related to a discontinued operation or an asset retirement obligation.

children.name: BusinessCombinationAcquisitionRelatedCosts
children.description: Amount of expense for acquisition-related cost incurred to effect business combination. Includes, but is not limited to, finder's fee; advisory, legal, accounting, valuation, and other professional and consulting fees; and general administrative cost, including cost of maintaining internal acquisition department.

children.description: Amount of gain (loss) recognized in net periodic benefit (cost) credit from irrevocable action relieving primary responsibility for benefit obligation and eliminating risk related to obligation and assets used to effect settlement.

children.description: Amount of write-down of assets recognized in the income statement. Includes, but is not limited to, losses from tangible assets, intangible assets and goodwill.

The offer is at a fixed price, usually at a premium over the current market price, and is contingent on shareholders' tendering a fixed number of their shares or units.

children.name: BusinessDevelopment
children.description: Business development involves the development of products and services, their delivery, design and their implementation. Business development involves evaluating a business and then realizing its full potential, using such tools as marketing, sales, information management and customer service.

children.name: RecoveryStrandedCosts
children.description: Revenue from billings to utility customers to recover what are also referred to as stranded assets or stranded investments. These are assets that formerly regulated utilities with monopolies on local service are allowed to recover during their transition to deregulated suppliers in competitive markets. Essentially, these investments are sunk costs, made by utilities under the old regulated system, which might not be recovered in a truly competitive marketplace. However, since they were valid investments at the time, the utilities are allowed to recover these costs from customers (for example, an investment in electrical generation assets that may not be recouped if customers are now allowed to purchase electricity from another utility).

children.description: The excess of (1) the carrying amount of the preferred stock in the registrant's balance sheet over (2) the fair value of the consideration transferred to the holders of the preferred stock, during the accounting period, which will be added to net earnings to arrive at net earnings available to common shareholders in the calculation of earnings per share.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: PreferredStockConversionsInducements
children.description: The excess of (1) the fair value of all securities and other consideration transferred in transactions by the registrant to the holders of the convertible preferred stock over (2) the fair value of securities issuable pursuant to the original conversion terms, during the accounting period.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: TemporaryEquityDividendsAdjustment
children.description: Accretion of temporary equity during the period due to cash, stock, and in-kind dividends. This item is an adjustment to net income necessary to derive net income apportioned to common stockholders and is to be distinguished from Temporary Equity, Accretion of Dividends (Temporary Equity, Accretion of Dividends).
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: TemporaryEquityAccretionToRedemptionValueAdjustment

children.description: Distributions from earnings to the general partner of a partnership included in the consolidated financial statements.

124000 - Statement - Statement of Income.name: WeightedAverageNumberOfDilutedSharesOutstanding

children.name: WeightedAverageNumberOfSharesOutstandingBasic
WeightedAverageNumberOfSharesIssuedBasic
children.description: This element represents the weighted average total number of shares issued throughout the period including the first (beginning balance outstanding) and last (ending balance outstanding) day of the period before considering any reductions (for instance, shares held in treasury) to arrive at the weighted average number of shares outstanding. Weighted average relates to the portion of time within a reporting period that common shares have been issued and outstanding to the total time in that period. Such concept is used in determining the weighted average number of shares outstanding for purposes of calculating earnings per share (basic).
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: WeightedAverageNumberOfSharesContingentlyIssuable
children.description: Shares issuable for little or no cash consideration upon the satisfaction of certain conditions (contingently issuable shares) are considered outstanding common shares and included in the computation of basic Earnings Per Share as of the date that all necessary conditions have been satisfied (in essence, when issuance of the shares is no longer contingent). Outstanding common shares that are contingently returnable (that is, subject to recall) are treated in the same manner as contingently issuable shares. Contingently issuable shares include shares that (a) will be issued in the future upon the satisfaction of specified conditions, (b) have been placed in escrow and all or part must be returned if specified conditions are not met, or (c) have been issued but the holder must return all or part if specified conditions are not met. The number of contingently issuable shares is determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that these shares have been outstanding to the total time in that period.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: WeightedAverageNumberOfSharesTreasuryStock
children.description: Number of shares of treasury stock determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that treasury shares have been outstanding to the total time in that period. Treasury stock is stock that the Entity has issued but subsequently reacquired.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: WeightedAverageNumberOfSharesCommonStockSubjectToRepurchaseOrCancellation
children.description: Number of shares of common stock subject to repurchase or cancellation determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that these shares have been outstanding to the total time in that period. Common stock subject to repurchase are outstanding common shares that are contingently returnable (that is, subject to recall).
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: WeightedAverageNumberOfSharesRestrictedStock
children.description: Number of shares of restricted stock determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that restricted shares have been outstanding to the total time in that period. Restricted shares are subject to sales, contractual, regulatory or other restrictions that prevent or inhibit the holder from freely disposing of them before the restriction ends.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.name: WeightedAverageNumberOfSharesEmployeeStockOwnershipPlanSharesNotCommittedToBeReleased
children.description: Number of employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) shares that have not been committed to be released determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that these shares have been outstanding to the total time in that period.
children.disclosure: 124000 - Statement - Statement of Income (Including Gross Margin)

children.description: Number of [basic] shares or units, after adjustment for contingently issuable shares or units and other shares or units not deemed outstanding, determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting period that common shares or units have been outstanding to the total time in that period.

An accelerated share repurchase program is a combination of transactions that permits an entity to purchase a targeted number of shares immediately with the final purchase price of those shares determined by an average market price over a fixed period of time.

children.name: InterestIncomeFederalFundsSold
children.description: Interest income on federal funds sold. Federal funds sold represent the excess federal funds held by one commercial bank which it lends to another commercial bank, usually at an agreed-upon (federal funds) rate of interest. Such loans generally are of short-duration (overnight).
children.disclosure: 940000 - Disclosure - Financial Services, Banking and Thrift

children.name: InterestIncomeSecuritiesPurchasedUnderAgreementsToResell
children.description: Interest income derived from securities purchased under agreements to resell. The difference in the price at which the institution buys the securities and resells the securities represents interest for the use of the funds by the other party. Most repurchase and sale agreements involve obligations of the federal government or its agencies, but other financial instruments, such as commercial paper, banker's acceptances and negotiable certificates of deposits are sometimes used in such transactions.
children.disclosure: 940000 - Disclosure - Financial Services, Banking and Thrift

children.description: The difference between the carrying value and the sale price of an investment. A loss would be recognized when the sale price of the investment is less than the carrying value of the investment. This element refers to the Loss included in earnings and not to the cash proceeds of the sale.

CostOfGoodsAndServicesSoldAmortization

children.name: PresentValueOfFutureInsuranceProfitsAmortizationExpense1
children.description: Amount of amortization expense (reversal of expense) for present value of future profits of insurance contract acquired in business combination.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: AmortizationOfIntangibleAssets
children.description: The aggregate expense charged against earnings to allocate the cost of intangible assets (nonphysical assets not used in production) in a systematic and rational manner to the periods expected to benefit from such assets.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: DeferredPolicyAcquisitionCostAmortizationExpense
children.description: Amount of amortization expense (reversal of expense) for deferred policy acquisition costs.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: DeferredSalesInducementsAmortizationExpense
children.description: Amount of amortization expense (reversal of expense) for deferred sales inducement cost.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: AmortizationOfValueOfBusinessAcquiredVOBA
children.description: The adjustment that represents the periodic charge against earnings to reduce the value of business acquired (VOBA) over the expected life of the underlying insurance contracts. VOBA reflects the estimated fair value of a life insurance business in force and represents the portion of the cost to acquire the business that is allocated to the value of the right to receive future cash flows from insurance contracts existing at the date of acquisition. Such value is the present value of the actuarially determined projected cash flows for the acquired policies. As a noncash expense, this element is added back to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: AmortizationOfDeferredLoanOriginationFeesNet
children.description: The net increase(decrease) in interest income during the period representing the allocation of deferred loan origination fees less deferred loan origination costs using the effective interest method over the term of the debt arrangement to which they pertain taking into account the effect of prepayments.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: AmortizationOfMortgageServicingRightsMSRs
children.description: The periodic amortization (in proportion to and over the period of estimated net servicing income or loss) of capitalized servicing rights, which contractually entitle the servicer to receive fees and ancillary revenues for performing billing, collection, disbursement and recordkeeping services in connection with a mortgage portfolio. As a noncash expense, this element is added back to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: AccretionAmortizationOfDiscountsAndPremiumsInvestments
children.description: The sum of the periodic adjustments of the differences between securities' face values and purchase prices that are charged against earnings. This is called accretion if the security was purchased at a discount and amortization if it was purchased at premium. As a noncash item, this element is an adjustment to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: AmortizationOfAcquisitionCosts
children.description: The amount of expense recognized in the current period that reflects the allocation of capitalized costs associated with acquisition of business. As a noncash expense, this element is added back to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: AmortizationOfDeferredSalesCommissions
children.description: The amount of expense recognized in the current period for the periodic realization of capitalized fees that were paid to salespeople, distributors, brokers, and agents at the time of the conclusion of the sale. As a noncash expense, this element is added back to net income when calculating cash provided by or used in operations using the indirect method.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: FinanceLeaseRightOfUseAssetAmortization
children.description: Amount of amortization expense attributable to right-of-use asset from finance lease.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: AmortizationOfPowerContractsEmissionCredits
children.description: The expense charged against earnings for the periodic recognition of capitalized costs related to purchasing power, fuel, or emission credits. These items may be purchased in one accounting period but are deducted from earnings over time through amortization.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: AmortizationOfNuclearFuelLease
children.description: Amount of amortization of nuclear fuel.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: AmortizationOfRegulatoryAsset
children.description: The expense charged against earnings during the period to allocate the capitalized costs of regulatory assets over the periods expected to benefit from such costs.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: AmortizationOfAdvanceRoyalty
children.description: The expense charged against earnings for the periodic recognition of the advance royalties. These royalties are paid in one accounting period, but are deducted from earnings over time through amortization. For example, royalties that are required to be paid in advance of production from a mineral, oil, or gas property and amortized over the period of right to produce these items.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: AmortizationOfDeferredPropertyTaxes
children.description: The amount of amortization charged against earnings during the period for deferred property taxes.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: AmortizationOfRateDeferral
children.description: The periodic expense to reduce the value of the rate deferral asset that is created when utilities under bill customers during periods of rate increases by deferring rate increases. These customers eventually pay higher rates to repay the utility for the rate deferral.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: AmortizationOfDeferredHedgeGains
children.description: The amount of expense charged against earnings by an Entity to record deferred gains and losses on hedge instruments. Examples include gain on economic hedges, amortization of gain on designated fair value hedge and so forth.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: OtherAmortizationOfDeferredCharges

AmortizationOfDebtDiscountPremium

children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

The adjustment can include the increase (decrease) during an accounting period in total estimated obligations recorded for probable future loss attributable to environmental contamination issues.

children.description: Amount of gain (loss) on sale or disposal of property, plant and equipment assets, including oil and gas property and timber property.

children.description: Amount of gain (loss) on sale or disposal of intangible assets.

GainLossOnSalesOfLoansNet
children.description: The net gain (loss) resulting from a sale of loans, including adjustments to record loans classified as held-for-sale at the lower-of-cost-or-market and fair value adjustments to loan held for investment purposes.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: GainLossOnSaleOfOtherLoansAndLeases
children.description: The gains (losses) included in earnings that represent the difference between the sale price and the carrying value of other loans and leases that were sold during the reporting period; excludes gains (losses) on sales of consumer and mortgage loans. This element refers to the gain (loss) and not to the cash proceeds of the sales. This element is a noncash adjustment to net income when calculating net cash generated by operating activities using the indirect method.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.description: The gains (losses) included in earnings that represent the difference between the sale price and the carrying value of loans and leases that were sold during the reporting period. This element refers to the gain (loss) and not to the cash proceeds of the sales. This element is a noncash adjustment to net income when calculating net cash generated by operating activities using the indirect method.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: PublicUtilitiesAllowanceForFundsUsedDuringConstructionAdditions
children.description: Total increase in earnings in the period representing the cost of equity (based on assumed rate of return) and/or borrowed funds (based on interest rate) used to finance construction of regulated assets, which is expected to be recovered through rate adjustments.

children.name: GainLossOnInvestments
RealizedInvestmentGainsLosses
GainLossOnSecuritizationOfFinancialAssets
children.description: A gain (loss) realized on a transfer, accounted for as a sale, of all or a portion of financial assets in which the transferor surrenders control and receives consideration other than a beneficial interest in the assets transferred. Reflects the amount of sales proceeds in excess of, or deficient from, the sum of the carrying amounts of transferred financial assets plus transaction costs.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: GainLossOnSaleOfProperties
children.description: The difference between the carrying value and the sale price of real estate or properties that were intended to be sold or held for capital appreciation or rental income. This element refers to the gain (loss) included in earnings and not to the cash proceeds of the sale. This element is a noncash adjustment to net income when calculating net cash generated by operating activities using the indirect method.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: GainsLossesOnSalesOfInvestmentRealEstate
children.description: The net gain (loss) resulting from sales and other disposals of real estate owned for investment purposes.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: GainLossOnSaleOfOtherInvestments
children.description: Amount of gain (loss) included in earnings for investments classified as other.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: EquityMethodInvestmentRealizedGainLossOnDisposal
children.description: Amount of gain (loss) on sale or disposal of an equity method investment.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.description: Amount of realized gain (loss) on investment.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: UnrealizedGainLossOnInvestments
children.description: Amount of unrealized gain (loss) on investment.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.description: Amount of realized and unrealized gain (loss) on investment.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: GainLossOnSaleOfDerivatives
children.description: The difference between the book value and the sale price of options, swaps, futures, forward contracts, and other derivative instruments. This element refers to the gain (loss) included in earnings.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: GainLossOnSaleOfCommodityContracts
children.description: The difference between the book value and the sale price of agreements to purchase or sell mineral resources, energy, and agricultural products at some future point. This element refers to the gain (loss) included in earnings and not to the cash proceeds.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: UnrealizedGainLossOnDerivativesAndCommodityContracts
UnrealizedGainLossOnDerivatives
children.description: The net change in the difference between the fair value and the carrying value, or in the comparative fair values, of derivative instruments, including options, swaps, futures, and forward contracts, held at each balance sheet date, that was included in earnings for the period.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: UnrealizedGainLossOnCommodityContracts
children.description: The net change in the difference between the fair value and the carrying value, or in the comparative fair values, of open agreements to purchase or sell mineral resources, energy, and agricultural products at some future point held at each balance sheet date, that was included in earnings for the period.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: UnrealizedGainLossOnEnergyContracts
children.description: The net change in the difference between the fair value and the carrying value, or in the comparative fair values, of open agreements to purchase or sell energy at some future point, held at each balance sheet date, that was included in earnings for the period.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.description: The net change in the difference between the fair value and the carrying value, or in the comparative fair values, of open derivatives, commodity, or energy contracts, held at each balance sheet date, that was included in earnings for the period.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: GainsLossesOnExtinguishmentOfDebt
children.description: Difference between the fair value of payments made and the carrying amount of debt which is extinguished prior to maturity.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncomeLossFromEquityMethodInvestmentsNetOfDividendsOrDistributions
IncomeLossFromEquityMethodInvestments

children.name: EquityMethodInvestmentDividendsOrDistributions
children.description: Amount of distribution received from equity method investee for return on investment, classified as operating activities. Excludes distribution for return of investment, classified as investing activities.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.description: This element represents the undistributed income (or loss) of equity method investments, net of dividends or other distributions received from unconsolidated subsidiaries, certain corporate joint ventures, and certain noncontrolled corporations; such investments are accounted for under the equity method of accounting. This element excludes distributions that constitute a return of investment, which are classified as investing activities.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: LeveragedLeasesIncomeStatementNetIncomeFromLeveragedLeases
children.description: The total recognized during the period for income on leases meeting the criteria for classification as leveraged leases.

children.name: GainLossOnSaleOfPreviouslyUnissuedStockBySubsidiaryOrEquityInvesteeNonoperatingIncome
children.description: The profit or loss on sales of previously unissued stock by subsidiaries or equity investees made to investors outside the consolidated group that is not reported as operating income. Represents the difference in the parent company's carrying amount of the equity interest in the subsidiary or equity investee immediately before and after the transaction.

children.name: DeferredIncomeTaxesAndTaxCredits
DeferredIncomeTaxExpenseBenefit

children.description: Gain (loss) related to the termination of a contract between the parties. The termination may be due to many causes including early termination of a lease by a lessee, a breach of contract by one party, or a failure to perform.

children.description: Amount of increase (decrease) of consideration paid in advance for supplies that provide economic benefits in future periods.

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInPrepaidInterest
children.description: Amount of increase (decrease) of consideration paid in advance for interest that provides economic benefits in future periods.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInPrepaidTaxes
children.description: Amount of increase (decrease) of consideration paid in advance for income and other taxes that provide economic benefits in future periods.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInPrepaidExpensesOther
children.description: Amount of increase (decrease) of consideration paid in advance for other costs that provide economic benefits in future periods.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the amount of outstanding money paid in advance for goods or services that bring economic benefits for future periods.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAssetsHeldForSale
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the period in book value of long-lived assets that the reporting entity plans to sell within one year (or one business cycle).
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInLoansHeldForSale
children.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in value of loan held with intention to sell or be securitized in near future.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInLoansDeferredIncome
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in net unamortized loan origination fees and other fees that are collected at origination but recorded as income over the life of the loan.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInOtherLoans
children.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in loans classified as other.

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAccruedInvestmentIncomeReceivable
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in investment income that has been earned but not yet received in cash.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInReserveForCommissionsExpenseAndTaxes
children.description: The change in the reserve for commissions, expenses and taxes recorded on the balance sheet, which is needed to adjust net income to arrive at net cash flows provided by or used in operations.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInFinancialInstrumentsUsedInOperatingActivities
IncreaseDecreaseInRiskManagementAssetsAndLiabilities
children.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in fair value of financial instruments other than those that are purchased and held principally for the purpose of hedging or mitigating market risk, credit risk, legal risk, operational risk and other types of risk.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInOtherFinancialInstrumentsUsedInOperatingActivities
children.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in fair value of other financial instruments used in operating activities.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the aggregate value of financial instruments used in operating activities, including trading securities, risk management instruments, and other short-term trading instruments.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInIntangibleAssetsCurrent
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in intangible assets (for example patents and licenses).
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInDepositOtherAssets
IncreaseDecreaseInDepositsOutstanding
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in monies given as security or collateral for items acquired or borrowed on a temporary basis. Deposits may also be paid as initial payment of the cost of acquisition or for the right to enter into a contract or agreement.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInMarginDepositsOutstanding
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in money or securities placed with a broker or counterparty as security for a trading or derivative position.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in moneys or securities given as security including, but not limited to, contract, escrow, or earnest money deposits, retainage (if applicable), deposits with clearing organizations and others, collateral, or margin deposits.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInDeferredIncomeTaxes
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the account that represents the temporary difference that results from Income or Loss that is recognized for accounting purposes but not for tax purposes and vice versa.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInDeferredFuelCosts
IncreaseDecreaseInDeferredGasCost
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in carrying amount of capitalized gas costs of a regulated entity that are expected to be recoverable through rate adjustments within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInDeferredElectricCost
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in carrying amount of capitalized electric costs of a regulated entity that are expected to be recoverable through rate adjustments within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in carrying amount of capitalized fuel costs of a regulated entity that are expected to be recoverable through rate adjustments within one year or the normal operating cycle, if longer.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInDeferredCharges
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the value of expenditures made during the current reporting period for benefits that will be received over a period of years. Deferred charges differ from prepaid expenses in that they usually extend over a long period of time and may or may not be regularly recurring costs of operation.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInDeferredLeasingFees
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the book value of deferred leasing fees. Amortization of these fees over the terms of the leases reduces deferred leasing fees. Originating new leases increases the balance of deferred leasing fees.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInClientFundsHeld
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the carrying amount of client funds held and maintained in custodial and separate accounts, and which are owned by clients or contract holders.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInDerivativeAssets
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the period in the carrying value of derivative instruments reported as assets that are due to be disposed of within one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer).
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInRecoverablePropertyDamageCosts
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the public utility damage costs that will be permitted by regulatory agencies to be recovered from rate payers.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAccruedCostOfOilAndGasReclamation
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in accrued costs that represent future cash outlays for restoration and reclamation of oil and gas producing properties.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInEnergyTradingActivity
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the value of long term assets generated by energy trading activities, which involve the purchase and sale of energy under forward contracts at fixed and variable prices and the buying and selling of financial energy contracts which include exchange futures and options and over the counter options and swaps.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInRecoverableRefundableGasCosts
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the asset or liability created by a public utility's ability to recover gas costs that are higher or lower than the basic cost included in rate payer calculations.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInUnprovedOilAndGasProperty
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the book value of property designated for oil and gas production that has not been found (through exploratory drilling) to have extractible reserves of oil and gas.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInGasImbalanceReceivable
children.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in receivable in gas-balancing arrangement in oil- and gas-producing activities.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInOtherRegulatoryAssets
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the value of other assets that are created when regulatory agencies permits public utilities to defer costs to the balance sheet.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInBalancingAccountUtility
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the asset created by the regulatory convention in which costs and revenues associated with certain utility expenses (such as fuel) are accumulated but on which no return is earned.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInAllowanceForEquityFundsUsedDuringConstruction
children.description: The increase (decrease) during the reporting period in the capitalized cost of equity (based on assumed rate of return) and / or borrowed funds (based on interest rate) used to finance construction of regulated assets, which is expected to be recovered through rate adjustments. As a result of this capitalization, net income is increased. This element pertains to certain regulated industries, such as public utilities.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInDepositsWithOtherFederalHomeLoanBanks
children.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in interest-bearing funds deposited into another Federal Home Loan Banks (FHLBanks).
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInLoansToFederalHomeLoanBanks
children.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in Federal Home Loan Bank (FHLBank) loans to another FHLBank.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInFilmCosts1
children.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in direct negative costs incurred in the physical production of a film. Examples include, but are not limited to, costs of story and scenario, compensation, set construction and postproduction costs.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: LifeInsuranceCorporateOrBankOwnedChangeInValue
children.description: The change in cash surrender or contract value during the period which adjusted the amount of premiums paid in determining the expense or income recognized under the contract for the period.
children.disclosure: 152200 - Statement - Statement of Cash Flows

children.name: IncreaseDecreaseInPrepaidDeferredExpenseAndOtherAssets
children.description: Amount of increase (decrease) in prepaid expenses, and assets classified as other.
